body_html:
What should the behavior be here? I see a couple of options:

  1. Raise an error if there's an unknown argument. This would be as simple as switching from parse_known_args to parse_args
  2. Display a warning if there's an unknown argument. I imagine parse_known_args was chosen for a reason, so this might be the option more in-line with the intention behind that decision
body_text:
What should the behavior be here? I see a couple of options:

Raise an error if there's an unknown argument. This would be as simple as switching from parse_known_args to parse_args
Display a warning if there's an unknown argument. I imagine parse_known_args was chosen for a reason, so this might be the option more in-line with the intention behind that decision
body:
What should the behavior be here? I see a couple of options:

1. Raise an error if there's an unknown argument. This would be as simple as switching from `parse_known_args` to `parse_args`
2. Display a warning if there's an unknown argument. I imagine `parse_known_args` was chosen for a reason, so this might be the option more in-line with the intention behind that decision
